hedline.hl1: By Independence Hall, A New Ritz-Carlton

abstract.p: Ritz-Carlton Philadelphia, chain's first new hotel in US in nearly decade, opens near Independence Hall; photo (S)

block.p: The Ritz-Carlton Philadelphia, the chain's first new hotel in the United States in almost 10 years, is now open at 10 Avenue of the Arts, occupying two landmark buildings near Independence Hall. Amenities include such innovations as a technology butler to solve problems without charge for laptop-carrying guests and a bath butler to draw one's bath and supply, at extra charge, Champagne and truffles or exotic scents.

The neo-Classical Girard-Mellon Bank buildings, with a rotunda copied from the Pantheon in Rome and a tower dating from the early 1900's, were designed by McKim, Mead & White. The renovation cost $88 million, giving the hotel 331 rooms, including a 2,100-square-foot penthouse, and 20,000 feet of meeting space, two restaurants and two lounges.

Amenities include such innovations as a technology butler to solve problems without charge for laptop-carrying guests and a bath butler to draw one's bath and supply, at extra charge, Champagne and truffles or exotic scents.

The neo-Classical Girard-Mellon Bank buildings, with a rotunda copied from the Pantheon in Rome and a tower dating from the early 1900's, were designed by McKim, Mead & White. The renovation cost $88 million, giving the hotel 331 rooms, including a 2,100-square-foot penthouse, and 20,000 feet of meeting space, two restaurants and two lounges.

Guest rooms, with extra-large windows, are done in gold and azure or gold, burgundy and green, with wood accents and moldings reminiscent of grand European hotels, along with prints of historic Philadelphia sites on the walls. There are cordless phones and outlets for high-speed Internet connections. The two-bedroom penthouse has an exercise room, a sauna, a kitchen and a living room. Guests on the four Club Floors below the penthouse have access to the services of a concierge and a lounge where free meals, snacks and drinks are served.
Rates range from $320 a night for a double room, $420 for a Club room and $3,500 for the penthouse. Reservations: (800) 241-3333 or (215) 735-7700.

TRAVEL ADVISORY Correction: July 16, 2000, Sunday A report in the Travel Advisory column on July 2 about the new Ritz-Carlton Hotel in Philadelphia misstated its distance from Independence Hall. It is not near Independence Hall but rather eight blocks away. A caption with the report misstated the nature of work on the hotel. It was under renovation, not under construction.
